TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . CARDINAL letters from the Secretariat of ORG , posted on DATE and on DATE , were intercepted , opened and read by the administration of the PERSON - Służewiec prison , where the applicant was detained on remand . They were subsequently forwarded to ORG , before which criminal proceedings against the applicant were pending at that time , and were read by the court .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested the President of ORG to explain what was the legal basis on which his correspondence with ORG had been opened and read .

CARDINAL . He reiterated his complaint on DATE in a letter to the President of ORG . In reply , on DATE the President of ORG informed him that LAW did not prohibit censorship of correspondence of persons detained on remand . It was also permitted under LAW § CARDINAL of LAW . The correspondence sent to ORG fell within the scope of this provision . It was further stated that the text of the Convention did not contain provisions relating to the inviolability of the correspondence to and from ORG .

CARDINAL . NORP The situation of persons detained on remand was at the relevant time governed by LAW of DATE . Under LAW , all correspondence of a detainee was to be opened , read and , if need be , subject to censorship , unless a prosecutor and a court decided otherwise . No provision of the Code provided for any remedy to contest the manner or scope of the censorship of a detainee ’s correspondence .

CARDINAL . The rights of persons detained on remand as regards their correspondence were further set out in LAW of the Rules on Detention on Remand . They provided that the correspondence of persons detained on remand was subject to screening by prison authorities and by authority conducting the criminal proceedings , i.e. either a public prosecutor or a court , depending on the stage reached in the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE a new Code of Enforcement of Criminal Sentences was enacted by parliament . Article CARDINAL of this Code , which entered into force on DATE , provides that the convicted persons are entitled to uncensored correspondence with the ORG authorities and with the ORG . LAW further provides that convicted persons and their lawyers may lodge complaints with the international agencies established under international treaties on protection of human rights , ratified by GPE . ORG correspondence in such cases shall be dispatched with no delay and is not subject to censorship .
CARDINAL . Pursuant to LAW , the rights of persons detained on remand shall , in principle , be the same as those of persons convicted by a final judgment .
